item.value: China has more than 350 million telephones, the most of any other country. The United States is second with 268 million.
The moon orbits the Earth every 27.32 days
The longest recorded flight of a chicken is thirteen seconds
The moon is 384,400 km from earth. If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
John Logie Baird was the inventor of the world's first working television system in Hastings, England in 1923.
The tallest woman was Zeng Jinlian. She was 2.48 meters ( 8ft 2in ) tall.
Roughly 70 percent of an adult's body is made up of water.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface.
Light travels slower through different substances such as glass, water and air.
The shortest person in the world is Khagendra Thapa Maga. He is 56 cm ( 22 in ) tall.
The earth is the 3rd planet from the sun and is the 5th largest planet in our solar system. Jupiter is the largest planet.
The explosion of Mount Tambora in Indonesia in 1815 has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
The longest word in a major English dictionary is 'Pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis'. It is 45 characters long.
There are more than 2,700 languages in the world.
Opened in 2010, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world. It is 828 meters ( 2,717 ft ) tall.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
On average, Elephants sleep for about 2 hours per day.
The explosion of Mount Tambora, on Sumbawa island, Indonesia in 1815 was heard 2,600 km (1,600 mi) away and has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
